6.title: "The Ambassador of the Shadows"
6.author: by J
6.appears_in: C. Mézières and P. Christin. p. 54-64 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 12 (Mar. 1981).
notes: Begins: "In search of Valerian and the ambassador, Laureline and Colonel Diol do a bit of high-price bargaining for a map (not a complete one, we may add) of Central Point. While on their quest, they meet up with the Kamuniks, a quasi-friendly tribe, who are willing to aid them in their search, for a price, that is."
Pages numbered 24-34.
"To be continued."

7.heading: Christin, Pierre, 1938-
7.title: "The Ambassador of the Shadows"
7.author: by P
7.appears_in: Christin and J.C. Mezieres. p. 48-59 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 1 (Apr. 1981).
notes: "Escaping from the Groubos, Laureline and Colonel Protocol steal a submarine and scuttle off to the Green Canal, only to find that they are not alone."
Final episode, paged 35-46.

57.heading: Christin, Pierre, 1938-
57.title: "La Ville qui n'Existait Pas"
57.author: texte, Christin ; dessin, Bilal
notes: Summary of previous installment: "A la mort du maître Jadencourt, Madeleine, son héritiére, a eu ces mots: 'payer pour tout cet argent qu'ils on ammassé....' Ensuite, avec son compagnon, elle a pris un certain nombre de dispositions devant permettre la création d'une cité idéale destinée à accueillir tos les habitants de Jadencourt. Là, enfin, ceux-ci connaîtront 'la vraie vie'..."
Plates numbered 39-54.
Final installment.

58.heading: Christin, Pierre, 1938-
58.title: "The Voyage of Those Forgotten"
58.author: story; P
58.appears_in: Christian ; art: Bilal. p. 66-73 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 8 (Nov. 1982).
notes: "Last we read, the people of Liternos, the floating village, decided to have a feast in celebration... well, in celebration of just being able to celebrate. Meanwhile, the army and news media alike are in frenzy, just not quite able to get a handle on the situation."
Final episode."

95.heading: Christine.
95.title: "Ramblings from Canada"
95.author: by Christine and Lisa
notes: Discussion of some Archie comic book stories involving the game of golf.

96.heading: Christine.
96.title: The Raspberry Ice Cream War : a comic for young people on a peaceful Europe without frontiers
96.author: idea and story: Matthias Ripp ; drawings, Atelier Wilinski, Mainz ; editor, Michael Jäger.

publication info.publisher: Office for Official Publications of the European Communities

notes: Published in all the official languages of the European Union.

Summary: 'A peaceful Europe without frontiers - Christine, Max and Paul take it for granted. Until a mysterious home page on the Internet pitches our three heroes into a land long before our time. Here, there are still guards at the city gate and every summer the raspberry ice cream war breaks out anew. The people in this country need a good lesson in democracy and Europe. Christine, Max and Paul arrive just in time to help'.

107.heading: Christison, Lindsay.
107.title: The Siege of Ladysmith
107.author: Clive MacDonnell Dixon ; now re-published with a new introduction by Lindsay Christison.
notes: A picture narrative of the siege, which took place at Ladysmith, South Africa, during the Anglo-Boer War of 1899-1902.
"This work, first published in London in 1900 as The Leaguer of Ladysmith, is re-published in a reduced format, to mark the centenary of the famous siege."

112.heading: Christman, Bert, 1915-1942.
112.title: "Island Uprising"
112.author: Bert Christman, script? ; Bert Christman, art
112.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 43 (Oct. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: A villain named Red Hatch is introduced and dies, and a girl named Australia Nelson is introduced.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

113.heading: Christman, Bert, 1915-1942.
113.title: "The Lost Scot Gold Mine, pt. 1"
113.author: Bert Christman
notes: Data from Jon Ingersoll, Bob Klein and Brian Mowbray of Grand Comics Database. I. Christman, Bert. II. 3 Aces. k. Scot Gold Mines. k. Gold Mines. k. Mines. Call no.: PN6728.1.N3A2m no.21

114.heading: Christman, Bert, 1915-1942.
114.title: "On the Waterfront"
114.author: Bert Christman (as Larry Dean), script? ; Bert Christman, art
114.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 41 (Aug. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Villains are Wing and his gang, introduced here ; introduction of Janice Blue.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

115.heading: Christman, Bert, 1915-1942.
115.title: "The Tarantula Strikes"
115.author: Bert Christman (as Larry Dean), script and art
115.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 40 (July 1939) ; reprinted in Justice League of America, no. 94 (Nov. 1971) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Introduction of The Sandman (Wesley Dodd or Dodds), and villain The Tarantula (Crossart).
The Sandman wears an orange business suit through issue 43.
Begins: "Extra! Vivian Dale kidnaped by"
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.
The distinctive title "Sandman Scores a Blow to Crime"* was assigned by Gene Reed in earlier indexing.

116.heading: Christman, Bert, 1915-1942.
116.title: "The Three Sandmen"
116.author: Bert Christman, script? ; Bert Christman, art
116.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 42 (Sept. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives v. 1.
notes: Sandman origin details given (he was in the service six years ago) ; villain Teeter Sneed is introduced and dies ; introduction of Dr. Clyde Dunlap and Happy O'Shea, who with Wes Dodds make up the "three Sandmen" ; introduction of Steve Weber.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

117.heading: Christman, Bert, 1915-1942--Articles About.
117.title: "The Sandman & Bert Christman" p. 3-6 in Ron Goulart's Comics History Magazine, no. 2
117.author: [No author]
notes: Notes on the career of Bert Christman, first artist of The Sandman, who worked on several aviation features.

118.heading: Christman, Bert, 1915-1942--Death.
118.title: "Real Heroes' Hall of Fame" text p. 49, 60 in Real Heroes, no. 5
118.author: [No author]
notes: About fundraising for the cost of the war by Boy Scouts and newsboys, and about nine-year-old Navajo artist Bea Tien Yazz, dentist William Morton, and the death of Bert Christman, artist of Scorchy Smith.

119.heading: Christman, Bert, 1915-1942--Miscellanea.
119.title: The Comic Artists Who Won the War
119.author: by Hal Higdon.
notes: 10 leaves : ill. ; 18 cm.
An early version of an article scheduled for Air & Space Smithsonian (Oct./Nov. 1994).

Summary: Discusses, in relation to World War II aviation, the work of comics artists Milton Caniff, Leslie Turner, Roy Crane, Hank Schlensker, Frank Robbins, Frank Miller, Will Eisner, Bert Christman, Zack Mosely, Dan Barry, and Jack Kirby.
